attributeDefinition: Identification number of survey location table representing a unique survey
Location where mini snorkel data was collected.
Temperature of water in degrees Fahrenheit measured continuously with StowAway electronic thermistors
River mile where survey was conducted. River mile was based on observation of surveyors when collecting data.
Number of divers during mini-snorkel survey
Width of channel at water line which may vary and is dependent on discharge.
Feather River channel type where survey was conducted.
Longitude of the survey location reported in decimal degress
Latitude of the survey location reported in decimal degress

Section of the Feather River where data were collected. HFC stands for High Flow Channel (below the Thermalito Afterbay outlet). LFC stands for Low Flow Channel (between Oroville Dam and the Thermalito Afterbay outlet)

Description of the method used to assign latitude and longitude. Coordinates were not reported for all survey locations. Those that were reported are labelled as reported in database. For those that were missing or were determined to be incorrect, a coordinate from a location with the same name was selected at random and are labelled as assigned based on similar location. Location information was collected while in the field using a handheld unit. These units are known to have measurement error of plus or minus 20 meters. Coordinates were not consistently collected at the start or end of the survey transect meaning another 25 feet (length of transect) should be added to this range. For those where a proxy location was used, the range of error is much greater and can be assumed to be anywhere within the general location.
